result.execSummary:
The defendant Porsha I Bates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Balance of attorney fees and court costs due by payment plan of $250 beginning 11/13/15. Failure to pay results in 1 day jail for every $25 owed. Any late or missed payments will void the expungment.
Submit to DNA sample and pay surcharge
Upon full payment of attorney fees and court costs and no missed or late payments.

Case recalled. Defendant Porsha I Bates in court with attorney Matthew E. Weil.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed.  Case to be recalled for amended information to be filed.
2:53am Case recalled, same appearances. Amended information filed. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence. Court orders atty fees and court costs be paid by a payment plan of $250 beginning 11/13/15, failure to pay results in 1 day jail for every $25 owed.  Any late or missed payment will result in voiding the expunction.

Defendant Porsha I Bates in court.  Patricia Clare Bradford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant doesn't qualify for public defender and has contacted 2 attorneys but cannot afford.  Court directs defendant to recontact counsel and finds good cause to extend time for preliminary hearing.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
w/conditions:  not to possess any weapons

Defendant Porsha I Bates appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel advises the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Counsel advises defendant turned self in on warrant and advises was unable to appear on court date due to a car accident.  State recommends $500 signature bond w/conditions.  Court examines defendant on right to counsel.    Defendant advises retaining private counsel.  Court finds good cause to extend time limits for holding of the prelim hrg.  Status hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:15 am.
